definitions.definition: receive (money, property, or a title) as an heir at the death of the previous holder.
examples: she inherited a fortune from her father
synonyms: receive; Morebe devised "she inherited his farm"bequeathed; hereditary

definitions.definition: derive (a quality, characteristic, or predisposition) genetically from one's parents or ancestors.
examples: she had inherited the beauty of her grandmother

definitions.definition: receive or be left with (a situation, object, etc.) from a predecessor or former owner.
examples: spending commitments inherited from previous administrations
synonyms: come into; formalaccede to "Richard inherited the title"

definitions.definition: come into possession of (belongings) from someone else.
examples: she inherits all her clothes from her older sisters

definitions.definition: come into possession of (something) as a right (especially in biblical translations and allusions).
examples: master, what must I do to inherit eternal life?
